definition: to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])

sentences.english: He will shine through your idle thoughts today, and help you understand the truth of love.
sentences.chinese: 他今天會照透你的無謂的雜念，幫你瞭解愛的真相。

sentences.english: Flow. Eliminate distractions, and really pour yourself into whatever you’re doing.
sentences.chinese: 摒除雜念，將你自己投入到你在做的事情中。

sentences.english: No superfluous ideas and personal considerations in mind, not feel any pain.
sentences.chinese: 心無雜念，不感到任何疼痛。

sentences.english: Empty your mind , be formless, shapless-like water.
sentences.chinese: 心無雜念，無招無形，像水一樣。

sentences.english: She has a strong sense of selfish consideration.
Scott Gill trusted himself, let go of the outcome and lived.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特吉爾相信自己的判斷，摒棄雜念快樂生活。

sentences.english: Have Yang Guo ever done no really and never once move miscellaneous one silk to read?
sentences.chinese: 難道楊過真的不曾動過一絲雜念？

sentences.english: Eliminate all distractions for a set time.
sentences.chinese: 規定時間內消除一切雜念。

sentences.english: Ray takes a long breath to calm himself down and exclude the idea out of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 雷長長的呼了一口氣讓自己平靜下來並且摒除雜念。

sentences.english: As soon as you are present, gently touch your thumb and forefinger together on each hand.
sentences.chinese: 一旦心無雜念，開始輕柔地同時撫摸拇指和食指。

sentences.english: We've all been guilty of selfishness at some time in our lives.
sentences.chinese: 我們都曾因一生中某個時間的私心雜念而愧疚過。

sentences.english: Only vaguely a few tourist. Quiet, isolated, with no ideas and personal considerations.
sentences.chinese: 只有依稀幾個進山的人，安靜，與世隔絕，心無雜念。

sentences.english: Stop all your thoughts for a minute.
Empty your mind. Be formless, shapless, like water.
sentences.chinese: 清空你的雜念，無形，無式，如水一般。

sentences.english: These thoughts become a form of distraction, pulling us away from our inner silence.
sentences.chinese: 就是這些雜念在分散注意力，把我們帶離內心的平靜。

sentences.english: He was wide-awake and his mind worked clearly, purged of all dross.
sentences.chinese: 他毫無睡意，腦子思維清楚，沒有任何雜念。

definition: to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
to sense/to perceive/to come to realize/to be aware
